- Add more charts to the documentation
- Closes https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/issues/456
- To locally view the updated book, run `mdbook build src/docs/goose-book --open`

title: enable status code summary by default
body:
- rename `--status-codes` to `--no-status-codes` (and `GooseDefault::StatusCodes` to `GooseDefault::NoStatusCodes`)
 - collect and summarize status codes by default
 - update the documentation (to review locally, run `mdbook build src/docs/goose-book --open`)
 - while updating the metrics book page (which originally included `--status-codes`) I also added the html report
 - closes https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/issues/439

title: rename GooseTaskSet to Scenario, GooseTask to Transaction
body: #449 rebased on top of `main`

title: Support multiple and variable speed Decrease attack phases
body: - Support multiple and variable speed decrease attack phases

title: #447: Cache build artifacts across CI builds.
body:
Closes #447.

Based on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64634535/github-actions-cache-rust-artifacts.

title: test test-plan
body:
- test configuration of test plan with `--test-plan` (which includes multiple Increase and Maintain steps)
 - test configuration of test plan with `GooseDefault::TestPlan` (which includes multiple Increase and Maintain steps)
 - internally configure `users` before `test_plan`, to avoid automatically setting the former when building the latter from `GooseDefault::TestPlan`
 - when calculating the `hatch_rate` from the test plan, subtract the first GooseUser thread of each step as it launches immediately without delay
 - determine when all users for a test plan are launched based on if running stand-alone or in a gaggle configuration, but not based on compiled-in features, as gaggles can be compiled in but not used
 - when tracking duration, round partial seconds (so 1.2 seconds rounds down to 1 second, and 1.6 seconds rounds up to 2 seconds -- previously 1.999 was still considered 1 second)
 - add longer delay in sequence test to account for improved accuracy on hatch_rate and duration tracking
 - closes https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/issues/442

title: Test plan steps overview should display times in the local timezone
body: closes #444

title: #440: Re-enable HTML report after introduction of test plans.
body:
Closes #440. 

- Re-enables report file
- Instead of starting, started, stopping, stopped summary displays a table of plan steps overview
- Removes "Starting" and "Stopping" section from graphs
- Add increasing (green) and decreasing (red) sections to the graph

![Screenshot 2022-04-21 at 12-24-03 Goose Attack Report](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376889/164440920-38cf1487-4f93-4ece-9efd-3928c38204e8.png)

title: clippy fixes from latest rust verison

title: Introduce `--test-plan` for more complex test plans
body:
- introduce `--test-plan` and `GooseDefault::TestPlan` for configuring test plans
 - closes https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/issues/365
 - use [`FromStr`] to auto convert `--test-plan "{users},{timespan};{users},{timespan}"`, where `{users}` must be an integer, ie "100", and `{timespan}` can be integer seconds or "30s", "20m", "3h", "1h30m", etc, to internal `Vec<(usize, usize)>` representation
 - don't allow `--test-plan` together with `--users`, `--startup-time`, `--hatch-rate` or `--run-time`
 - add page to https://book.goose.rs/ explaining how to configure test plans

### From the new book page:
> The following command tells Goose to start 10 users over 60 seconds and then to run for 5 minutes before shutting down:
> ```bash
> $ cargo run --release -- -H http://local.dev/ --startup-time 1m --users 10 --run-time 5m
> ```
>
> The exact same behavior can be defined with the following test plan:
> ```bash
> $ cargo run --release -- -H http://local.dev/ --test-plan "10,1m;10,5m;0,0"
> ```
>
> Another possibility when specifying a test plan is to add load spikes into otherwise steady load. For example, in the  following example Goose starts 500 users over 5 minutes and lets it run with a couple of traffic spikes to 2,500 users:
> ```bash
> $ cargo run --release -- -H http://local.dev/ --test-plan "500,5m;500,5m;2500,45;500,45;500,5m;2500,45;500,45;500,5m;0,0"
> ```

In the current implementation, a test plan can only Increase and Maintain, the load test will shut down any time it defines a Decrease. This will be resolved in a followup.

An example run:
```bash
% cargo run --release --example drupal_memcache -- --host http://apache.fosciana/ --test-plan "10,5;20,5;30,5;30,5;60,10;60,2;0,0"
```

Includes the follow overview in the metrics:
```
 === OVERVIEW ===
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Action       Started             Stopped           Elapsed    Users
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Increasing:  22-04-18 07:07:06 - 22-04-18 07:07:11 (00:00:05, 0 -> 10)
 Increasing:  22-04-18 07:07:11 - 22-04-18 07:07:17 (00:00:06, 10 -> 20)
 Increasing:  22-04-18 07:07:17 - 22-04-18 07:07:22 (00:00:05, 20 -> 30)
 Maintaining: 22-04-18 07:07:22 - 22-04-18 07:07:27 (00:00:05, 30)
 Increasing:  22-04-18 07:07:27 - 22-04-18 07:07:40 (00:00:13, 30 -> 60)
 Maintaining: 22-04-18 07:07:40 - 22-04-18 07:07:42 (00:00:02, 60)
 Decreasing:  22-04-18 07:07:42 - 22-04-18 07:07:42 (00:00:00, 0 <- 60)

 Target host: http://apache.fosciana/
 goose v0.16.0-dev
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
```

title: wake regularly during startup
body:
- wake up a couple times a second to handle message and allow for a quick shutdown if the load test is canceled during startup
 - fix #401

title: release 0.15.2
body:
## 0.15.2
 - [#391](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/391) properly sleep for configured `set_wait_time()` walking regularly to exit quickly if the load test ends
 - [#394](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/394) add additional graphs to the HTML report: errors per second, average response time, active users, active tasks
 - [#403](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/403) wake up a couple times a second to handle message and allow for a quick shutdown if the load test is canceled during startup

title: Add additional graphs to the HTML report
body: Closes #246. ## Graphs - Errors per second - Average response time per second - Active users per second - Active tasks per second ## Screenshots ### Errors ![Screenshot 2021-11-24 at 16-07-12 Goose Attack Report](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/376889/143273822-0bd6c449-1dcd-4674-9343-97f6e8d48a46.png) ### Response time ### Active users

title: Add automated tests for requests per second graph in HTML report
body: This is a follow-up of #381 and is part of #246.

title: simplify set_wait_time sleep loop; include test
body:
- [#391](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/391) properly sleep for configured `set_wait_time()` walking regularly to exit quickly if the load test ends
 - fixes #390 

The sleep loop logic was over-complicated, and a logical error was causing GooseUsers to sleep for an indefinitely long time. Also added a test that will fail if this regresses again.

title: release 0.15.1
body:
- [#374](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/374) renamed `simple-with-session.rs` to `session.rs` and `simple-closure.rs` to `closure.rs` to avoid confusion with the `simple.rs` example as they all do different things
 - [#385](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/385) properly configure `--running-metrics VALUE` when set manually
 - [#382](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/382) set client timeout to 60 seconds by default, used for all requests made; introduce `--timeout VALUE` where VALUE is seconds as integer or a float; timeout can be configured programatically using `GooseDefault::Timeout`
 - [#381](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/381) display requests per second graph on the HTML report

title: #246: Add requests per second graph in HTML report to the changelog.
body: This sneaked out of the original pull request.

title: set default request timeout of 60 seconds, configurable
body:
- [#382](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/382) set client timeout to 60 seconds by default, used for all requests made; introduce `--timeout VALUE` where VALUE is seconds as integer or a float; timeout can be configured programatically using `GooseDefault::Timeout`
 - introduces `utils::get_float_from_string()`, now used by `utils::get_hatch_rate()`
 - updates `set_client_builder()` documentation to reflect how this changes the default Reqwest Client configuration

title: increase Goose's default verbosity
body:
The following API changes increase Goose's default verbosity. To hide `[INFO]` level messages and restore the previous default launch with `-q` (or set `GooseDefault::Quiet`). To hide metrics being displayed after the load test runs launch with `--no-print-metrics` (or set `GooseDefault::NoPrintMetrics`) to restore the previous functionality of running `GooseAttack::execute()` without adding `.print()`.

 - [#379](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/379) **API change**: default to `INFO` level verbosity, introduce `-q` to reduce Goose verbosity
   o **note**: `-v` now sets Goose to `DEBUG` level verbosity which when enabled will negatively impact load test performance; set `-q` to restore previous verbosity
 - [#379](https://github.com/tag1consulting/goose/pull/379) **API change**: remove `.print()` which is no longer required to display metrics after a load test, disable with `--no-print-metrics` or `GooseDefault::NoPrintMetrics`
